      • RandomAccessDoubleLinkedList

    • Method Detail

      • insertAt

        public void insertAt(int index,
            java.lang.Comparable val)
              throws InvalidAccessException
        Inserts a new element with value val at the given index. If the index is larger than the current size, the list is padded with uninitialized DLNodes.
        Parameters:
        index - at this point you want to insert.
        val - the number you want to insert.
        Throws:
        InvalidAccessException - if the index is smaller than 0

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.Comparable val)
        Returns true if an element with the given value exists, false otherwise. However, true is returned upon the first occurrence of val.
        Parameters:
        val - the value you are looking for.
        Returns:
        true if the element exists false if not.

      • removeAt

        public boolean removeAt(int index)
                 throws InvalidAccessException
        Removes the element at the given index. False is returned if index > list's size.
        Parameters:
        index - element at the index will be removed.
        Returns:
        true if the element was removed
        Throws:
        InvalidAccessException - if the list is null or the index is smaller or bigger than the list

      • removeAll

        public boolean removeAll(java.lang.Comparable val)
        Removes all elements with the given value. False if returned if val was not found.
        Parameters:
        val - all elements which are containing val will be removed.
        Returns:
        true if all elements are removed and false if not.
        Throws:
        InvalidAccessException

      • elementAt

        public java.lang.Comparable elementAt(int index)
                               throws ValueException
        Returns the integer value at the given index. If index > list's size, a ValueException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        index - the position in the list you want to know the element
        Returns:
        the value saved in the element
        Throws:
        ValueException - if the list is null or the node at the index is not initialized

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method.
        Parameters:
        args -
